Question & Options:
In the 2007 movie 'There Will Be Blood', what causes the conflict between Daniel and Eli?
Options:
A. Eli accuses Daniel of being dishonest.
B. Eli attacks and berates Daniel for trusting Daniel's enemy.
C. Daniel steals Eli's oil.
D. Daniel refuses to invest in Eli's church.
Correct Answer: Eli attacks and berates Daniel for trusting Daniel's enemy.

Question & Options:
In the 2007 movie 'There Will Be Blood', what causes Daniel to become suspicious of Henry?
Options:
A. Henry's refusal to work with Daniel
B. Henry's inability to recognize a joke
C. Henry's secretive behavior about his past
D. Henry's financial dealings with Daniel
Correct Answer: Henry's inability to recognize a joke

Question & Options:
In the 2007 film 'There Will Be Blood', what does Daniel Plainview refuse from Standard Oil in favor of a deal with Union Oil?
Options:
A. A partnership to drill for oil
B. A buyout of his local interests
C. Financial support for his business
D. A chance to expand his operations
Correct Answer: A buyout of his local interests

Question & Options:
In the 2007 movie 'There Will Be Blood', which character acts as an impediment to Daniel's plans by refusing to allow the pipeline to run across his ranch?
Options:
A. Bandy
B. Daniel
C. H.W.
D. Henry

In the 2007 film 'There Will Be Blood', what does Eli coerce Daniel into confessing during his baptism in Eli's church?
Options:
A. That he is in love with Eli
B. That he abandoned his child
C. That he wants to run a pipeline across Bandy's ranch
D. That he is not a true oilman

In the 2007 film 'There Will Be Blood', what does H.W. ask his father Daniel to do regarding their partnership?
Options:
A. To expand their oil business together
B. To dissolve their partnership so he can move to Mexico
C. To invest in a new venture
D. To bring in a third partner
Correct Answer: To dissolve their partnership so he can move to Mexico

In the 2007 movie 'There Will Be Blood', what is Daniel's character described as?
Options:
A. A poor but ambitious individual
B. Wealthy but an alcoholic
C. A struggling oil worker
D. An honest businessman

In the 2007 film 'There Will Be Blood', which character is described as living alone in a large mansion?
Options:

D. Henry Brands

In the 2007 movie 'There Will Be Blood', what is the relationship between H.W. and Daniel?
Options:

B. H.W. is Daniel's son
C. H.W. is Daniel's business partner
D. H.W. is Daniel's rival

In the 2007 movie 'There Will Be Blood', what is the relationship between Mary and H.W.?
Options:
A. Mary is H.W.'s mother.
B. Mary is the person that H.W. wants to move to Mexico with.
C. Mary is H.W.'s business partner.
D. Mary is H.W.'s teacher.
Correct Answer: Mary is the person that H.W. wants to move to Mexico with.

Question & Options:
In the movie 'There Will Be Blood' (2007), how does Little Boston relate to the Great Depression?
Options:
A. Little Boston thrives during the Great Depression.
B. Little Boston suffers from the Great Depression.
C. Little Boston is unaffected by the Great Depression.
D. Little Boston becomes a major economic center during the Great Depression.
Correct Answer: Little Boston suffers from the Great Depression.

Question & Options:
In the 2007 movie 'There Will Be Blood', how did Daniel drain Bandy's property of oil?
Options:
A. By negotiation with Bandy
B. By capture
C. Through drilling permits
D. By purchasing the land

In the 2007 film 'There Will Be Blood', what role does Eli take on as described in the plot?
Options:
A. A wealthy oil baron
B. A radio preacher
C. A corrupt politician
D. A struggling farmer

In the 2007 movie 'There Will Be Blood', what condition does Daniel impose on Eli when they partner in drilling Bandy's property?
Options:
A. Eli must pay a fee for the drilling rights.
B. Eli must denounce his faith.
C. Eli must provide additional labor for the project.
D. Eli must share his profits with Daniel.

In the 2007 movie 'There Will Be Blood', what role does the butler play in the scene involving the bowling alley commotion?
Options:
A. He reports the commotion to Daniel.
B. He participates in the bowling game.
C. He ignores the commotion.
D. He is the cause of the commotion.
Correct Answer: He reports the commotion to Daniel.

Question & Options:
In the 2007 film 'There Will Be Blood', what does Daniel do to Eli after chasing him around the alley?
Options:
A. He forgives him and walks away.
B. He bludgeons him to death with a bowling pin.
C. He offers him a business partnership.
D. He helps him escape from danger.
Correct Answer: He bludgeons him to death with a bowling pin.
